ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How clear are you about the limits of your authority in your present job?
Notes: 1= Not at all clear; 5= Perfectly clear; 999= NA/NK/Missing

ElementDescription: Do you feel you are always as clear as you would like to be about what you have to do on your job?
Notes: 1= Not at all clear; 5= Perfectly clear; 999= NA/NK/Missing

ElementDescription: Do you feel you are always as clear as you would like to be about how you are supposed to do things on your job?
Notes: 1= Not at all clear; 5= Perfectly clear; 999= NA/NK/Missing

ElementDescription: In general, how clearly defined are policies and the various rules, procedures, and regulations of the company that affect your job?
Notes: 1= Not at all clear; 5= Perfectly clear; 999= NA/NK/Missing

ElementDescription: In general, how clearly defined are the rules, policies, and procedures of your department that affect your job?
Notes: 1= Not at all clear; 5= Perfectly clear; 999= NA/NK/Missing
